description: From Latin arrogātus, perfect passive participle of adrogō, arrogō (“ask of, adopt, appropriate, assume”), from ad (“to”) + rogō (“ask”).

verbs.description: arrogate (third-person singular simple present arrogates, present participle arrogating, simple past and past participle arrogated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, uncommon) To appropriate or lay claim to something for oneself without right. [from 1530s]
